intro: Wissadula balansae, commonly known as the Balansae bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Wissadula balansae is considered a species of conservation concern.
